alert.note: Alert for Alleghany; Ashe (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 28 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Flood Advisory In Effect for Alleghnay County North Carolina, Ashe County North Carolina, and Grayson County in southwest Virginia until 830 PM EDT This Evening... ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall from showers and thunderstorms is expected. * WHERE...The following counties in North Carolina...Alleghany NC and Ashe NC. The following county in southwest Virginia...Grayson. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. Small streams and creeks may quickly rise to flood stage due to already saturated ground in the area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 426 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to showers and thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen during the past 1 to 1 1/2 hours. Additional rainfall up to 2 inches is possible during the next couple of hours. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Jerry Creek, Bear Branch, Crab Fork, Dog Creek, Bridle Creek, Dry Run, Guffey Creek, Elk Creek, Dry Creek, Comers Rock Branch, Darnell Creek, Farmers Branch, Fox Creek, Flag Pond Branch, Helton Creek and Grassy Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jefferson... West Jefferson... Mouth Of Wilson... Glendale Springs... Piney Creek... Grassy Creek... Volney... - For additional information on creek, stream, river, and lake levels within our forecast area, please visit our web page located at http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
